name: 0nprm

body.origin:
|- wn(wcel(nat0, cprime))
-| wn(wcel(nat0, cn))
-| wi(wcel(nat0, cprime), wcel(nat0, cn))

cumulated.origin:
|- wn(wcel(nat0, cprime))
-| wn(wcel(nat0, cn))
-| wi(wcel(nat0, cprime), wcel(nat0, cn))

|- wn(wcel(nat0, cprime))
-| wi(wcel(nat0, cprime), wcel(nat0, cn))

comment: 0 is not a prime number. Already the definition ~ df-prm excludes 0 from being prime ( ` Prime = { p e. NN | ... ` ), but even if ` p e. NN0 ` was allowed, the condition ` { n e. NN | n || p } ~~ 2o ` would not hold for ` p = 0 ` , because ` { n e. NN | n || 0 } = NN ` , see ~ dvds0 , and ` -. NN ~~ 2o ` (there are more than 2 positive integers). (Contributed by AV, 29-May-2023.)
